perturbation.original_text: (a) If there has been a successful Remarketing, the Company shall pay to the Remarketing Agent for the performance of its services as Remarketing Agent hereunder on the Remarketing Settlement Date, by wire transfer to an account designated by the Remarketing Agent, a fee in an amount equal to 25 basis points (0.25%) of the Accreted Value of the Remarketed Securities.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) If there has been a successful Remarketing, the Company may, at its sole discretion, pay to the Remarketing Agent for the performance of its services as Remarketing Agent hereunder on the Remarketing Settlement Date, by wire transfer to an account designated by the Remarketing Agent, a fee that may or may not be equal to 25 basis points (0.25%) of the Accreted Value of the Remarketed Securities.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Company *shall* pay a fee equal to 25 basis points of the Accreted Value. The modified text makes the payment discretionary, introducing the phrase *'the Company may, at its sole discretion'* and changing the fee amount to *'may or may not be equal to'* creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: The Remarketing Agent agrees to: (i) use its commercially reasonable efforts to remarket the Remarketing Securities deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agent in the Remarketing pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures; (ii) notify the Issuers promptly of the Reset Rate; and (iii) carry out such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agent in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with the provisions of the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text: The Remarketing Agent may, at its convenience: (i) use its best judgment whether to remarket the Remarketing Securities deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agent in the Remarketing pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures; (ii) notify the Issuers when convenient of the Reset Rate; and (iii) carry out such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agent only if it deems appropriate in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with the provisions of the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Remarketing Agent agrees to use 'commercially reasonable efforts' and *shall* perform specific duties. The changed text alters this to give the agent more discretion, stating the agent *may* use 'best judgment' and only perform duties *if it deems appropriate.*

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall terminate (i) the Business Day immediately following the Remarketing Settlement Date, (ii) at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on the last date of the Remarketing if the Remarketing is not successful or (iii) on the effective date of the resignation or removal of the Remarketing Agent and the appointment of a new Remarketing Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall terminate (i) the Business Day immediately following the Remarketing Settlement Date, (ii) at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on the last date of the Remarketing if the Remarketing is not successful or (iii) on the effective date of the resignation or removal of the Remarketing Agent; however, the agreement may continue at the discretion of the Trust, irrespective of appointment of a new Remarketing Agent.
perturbation.explanation: The original section defines specific conditions under which the agreement terminates. The modified version adds language suggesting that termination may not occur even after conditions for it are met, at the discretion of the Trust, creating uncertainty about the agreement's duration.
